outpatient_healthy.notes: First-line for previously healthy adults with non-severe CAP

outpatient_comorbid.dosing: Amoxicillin 1g PO TID + Azithromycin 500mg PO day 1, then 250mg PO daily for 4 days
outpatient_comorbid.notes: For patients with comorbidities or atypical pathogen concerns

inpatient_non_icu.dosing: Ampicillin 2g IV q6h + Azithromycin 500mg IV/PO daily
inpatient_non_icu.duration: 5 days (switch to oral when clinically stable)

inpatient_icu.dosing: Ceftriaxone 2g IV daily + Azithromycin 500mg IV/PO daily
inpatient_icu.duration: 7 days (switch to oral when clinically stable)
inpatient_icu.notes: For ICU patients without Pseudomonas risk factors

outpatient_mild.notes: First-line for previously healthy children with non-severe CAP

outpatient_atypical.dosing: 10mg/kg PO on day 1 (max 500mg), then 5mg/kg PO daily for 4 days (max 250mg)

inpatient.dosing: Ampicillin 200-300mg/kg/day IV divided q6h (max 12g/day) OR Ceftriaxone 50-75mg/kg/day IV daily (max 2g/day)
inpatient.duration: 5-7 days (switch to oral when clinically stable)
inpatient.notes: Add azithromycin if atypical pathogens suspected

penicillin_allergy_anaphylactic.dosing: Levofloxacin 750mg PO/IV daily OR Moxifloxacin 400mg PO/IV daily
penicillin_allergy_anaphylactic.notes: Reserve for true penicillin allergy or treatment failure. Avoid in pregnancy.

penicillin_allergy_non_anaphylactic.dosing: 30mg/kg/day PO divided BID (max 1g/day) or 150mg/kg/day IV divided q8h (max 4.5g/day)

penicillin_allergy_anaphylactic.dosing: Azithromycin: 10mg/kg PO on day 1 (max 500mg), then 5mg/kg PO daily for 4 days (max 250mg) OR Clarithromycin: 15mg/kg/day PO divided BID (max 1g/day)
penicillin_allergy_anaphylactic.notes: For anaphylactic penicillin allergy. Less effective against pneumococcus.

female_non_pregnant.notes: First-line if CrCl ≥30; covers typical uropathogens. Avoid in pyelonephritis.

alternative_1.notes: First-line if local E. coli resistance <20%. Contraindicated in 3rd trimester pregnancy.

alternative_2.notes: First-line alternative for uncomplicated UTI. Useful for multidrug-resistant organisms.

alternative.dosing: 40mg/kg/day of amoxicillin component PO divided TID (max 1.5g/day)

reserve.notes: Reserve for complicated cases or intolerance (high collateral resistance risk). Avoid in pregnancy.

pregnancy.dosing: Nitrofurantoin 100mg PO BID (avoid at term) OR Cephalexin 500mg PO QID
pregnancy.notes: Safe options during pregnancy. Avoid TMP-SMX in first trimester and near term.

standard.dosing: Ceftriaxone 2g IV q12h + Vancomycin 15-20mg/kg IV q8-12h
standard.notes: Add ampicillin 2g IV q4h if >50 years or immunocompromised (for Listeria coverage)

healthcare_associated.dosing: Meropenem 2g IV q8h + Vancomycin 15-20mg/kg IV q8-12h

standard.dosing: Ceftriaxone 100mg/kg/day IV divided q12h (max 4g/day) + Vancomycin 60mg/kg/day IV divided q6h (max 4g/day)
standard.notes: Add ampicillin 300mg/kg/day IV divided q6h (max 12g/day) if <3 months

neonatal.dosing: Ampicillin 300mg/kg/day IV divided q6h + Cefotaxime 200mg/kg/day IV divided q6h

penicillin_allergy.dosing: Meropenem 2g IV q8h + Vancomycin 15-20mg/kg IV q8-12h

carbapenem_allergy.dosing: Aztreonam 2g IV q6-8h + Vancomycin 15-20mg/kg IV q8-12h + TMP-SMX 5mg/kg TMP component IV q8h
carbapenem_allergy.notes: For patients with both beta-lactam and carbapenem allergies

penicillin_allergy.dosing: Meropenem 120mg/kg/day IV divided q8h (max 6g/day) + Vancomycin 60mg/kg/day IV divided q6h (max 4g/day)

non_purulent.dosing: Cephalexin 500mg PO QID OR Cloxacillin 500mg PO QID

purulent_mrsa_risk.dosing: TMP-SMX 1-2 DS tablets PO BID OR Doxycycline 100mg PO BID
purulent_mrsa_risk.notes: For purulent cellulitis or MRSA risk factors

severe_outpatient.dosing: Cephalexin 500mg PO QID + TMP-SMX 1-2 DS tablets PO BID
severe_outpatient.notes: For coverage of both streptococci and MRSA in outpatient setting

inpatient.duration: 5-10 days (switch to oral when clinically stable)

purulent_mrsa_risk.dosing: TMP-SMX 8-12mg/kg/day TMP component PO divided BID (max 320mg TMP/day) OR Clindamycin 30mg/kg/day PO divided TID (max 1.8g/day)
purulent_mrsa_risk.notes: For purulent cellulitis or MRSA risk factors

penicillin_allergy.dosing: 300-450mg PO QID or 600-900mg IV q8h (for severe infections)

mrsa_inpatient.dosing: Vancomycin 15-20mg/kg IV q8-12h OR Linezolid 600mg PO/IV BID

penicillin_allergy.dosing: 30mg/kg/day PO divided TID (max 1.8g/day) or 40mg/kg/day IV divided q6-8h (max 2.7g/day)

standard.notes: First-line for adults with acute otitis media requiring antibiotics

standard.duration: 10 days if <2 years; 5-7 days if ≥2 years
standard.notes: First-line for AOM. High-dose to cover penicillin-nonsusceptible S. pneumoniae.

recurrent_treatment_failure.dosing: 90mg/kg/day of amoxicillin component PO divided BID (max 3g amoxicillin/day)
recurrent_treatment_failure.duration: 10 days if <2 years; 5-7 days if ≥2 years
recurrent_treatment_failure.notes: Second-line if amoxicillin failure or conjunctivitis (think β-lactamase H. influenzae). Use high-dose formulation to limit clavulanate (less GI side effects).

penicillin_allergy_anaphylactic.dosing: Azithromycin 500mg PO day 1, then 250mg PO daily for 4 days OR Clarithromycin 500mg PO BID
penicillin_allergy_anaphylactic.notes: For anaphylactic penicillin allergy. Less effective against pneumococcus.

penicillin_allergy_non_anaphylactic.duration: 10 days if <2 years; 5-7 days if ≥2 years

penicillin_allergy_anaphylactic.dosing: 10mg/kg PO on day 1 (max 500mg), then 5mg/kg PO daily for 4 days (max 250mg)
penicillin_allergy_anaphylactic.notes: For anaphylactic penicillin allergy. Less pneumococcal coverage; use only if β-lactams contraindicated.
